question_text: A 21-year-old man develops an acute, painful skin lesion on the left lateral thigh.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is a staphylococcal abscess (Option D). Abscesses are soft-tissue infections composed of collections of pus and bacteria within the dermis and subcutaneous tissue. They are most commonly caused by Staphylococcus aureus. A staphylococcal abscess typically presents as a tender, erythematous, fluctuant nodule topped by a central pustule.
